com.analog.lyric.collect

Class AtomicStampedDouble

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.analog.lyric.collect.AtomicStampedDouble
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.io.Serializable

    @ThreadSafe
public class AtomicStampedDouble
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.io.Serializable
    Maintains a double value along with an integer "stamp" that can be updated atomically.

    This is a slightly more efficient alternative to AtomicStampedReference<Double> and unlike that class is serializable.

    Since:
    0.05
    See Also:
    AtomicStampedReference, Serialized Form

      Constructors

      AtomicStampedDouble()

      Copies value and stamp from another instance.

      Constructs with given value and stamp.

    • Method Detail

      • attemptStamp

        public final boolean attemptStamp(double expectedValue,
                   int newStamp)
        Attempts to change the stamp if value matches expectedValue.
        Returns:
        false if current value does not match expectedValue or if value or stamp is changed in another thread during this call.

        See Also:
        compareAndSet(double, double, int, int)

      • compareAndSet

        public final boolean compareAndSet(double expectedValue,
                    double newValue,
                    int expectedStamp,
                    int newStamp)
        Attempts to change the value and stamp atomically if current values match old values.
        Returns:
        false if current value or stamp does not match expected values or if value or stamp is changed in another thread during this call.

        See Also:
        attemptStamp(double, int), setAndIncrementStamp(double)

      • get

        public final double get()
        Gets the current value.

      • get

        Returns the current value and writes into stampHolder the current stamp value.
        Parameters:
        stampHolder - must have lenght of at least one.

      • setAndIncrementStamp

        public final boolean setAndIncrementStamp(double value)
        Sets the value and atomically increments the stamp if the value changed.
        Returns:
        false if the value was not set because it was set by another thread
        See Also:
        compareAndSet(double, double, int, int)
